title: How to Own at Battlefield 2

steps.headline: Start off as a medic and obtain the G36E (the last medic unlock-you can only get this if you have played the expansion, Special Forces, on your account at least once).
Be sure to revive as many people as possible.
steps.description: To do this get in a squad or with a group of people and stay just behind them. When one of them dies, immediately sprint forward, go prone on top of him, revive him and get back again. Don't worry about if he actually gets up and keeps playing, if he dies right after you revive him, dive and do it again. More points for you.

steps.headline: Spam medic bags in populated areas.
Be aware of your surroundings and popular player routes
Make sure you have a fine mouse and keyboard.
Or, just use a jet, a decent jet pilot with no competition will be in the top 3 every round.
Create an offline server for gulf of Oman 64 player size.
steps.description: get in the bomber and practice taking off and looping in the air and bombing targets. if you can't bomb things you will get almost no kills.

steps.headline: once you are good enough so that you can fly without crashing and can bomb targets go online.
steps.description: try to find a server that has a no attacking uncaps with vehicles rule, as this makes it easier to get into the air.

steps.headline: once you're up and flying, make sure you spend most of your time above 200 feet (61.0 m) and constantly look behind you, this prevents being shot down.
if you find a target, drop downwards so that you are almost heading straight down, when the target lines up drop bombs and pull up, go to the runway, re arm and repeat.
steps.description: convoys and populated areas are good targets as you can get 5+ kills in one bombing run. If you are in a server where you can attack the enemy's uncap then this will bring in lots of kills although this is very unfair for the opposition and they will probably want to kick you.

steps.headline: make sure that if you find an enemy jet, follow it and shoot it down.
steps.description: enemy jets are a big threat to you.

steps.headline: stay alive at all costs.
steps.description: the worst thing about flying jets is trying to get into them. there is usually a mob of noobs that exist for the sole purpose of jumping in front of you forcing a tk, not to mention all the enemy vehicles/snipers that see a person waiting for a jet as an easy kill. once you are good at it, jet flying can become the funnest part of bf2.

text: Start off as a medic and obtain the G36E (the last medic unlock-you can only get this if you have played the expansion, Special Forces, on your account at least once).  Use this weapon whenever possible.  Be sure to revive as many people as possible. To do this get in a squad or with a group of people and stay just behind them. When one of them dies, immediately sprint forward, go prone on top of him, revive him and get back again. Don't worry about if he actually gets up and keeps playing, if he dies right after you revive him, dive and do it again. More points for you. Spam medic bags in populated areas.  Be aware of your surroundings and popular player routes  Make sure you have a fine mouse and keyboard.  Own it up.  Or, just use a jet, a decent jet pilot with no competition will be in the top 3 every round.  Create an offline server for gulf of Oman 64 player size. get in the bomber and practice taking off and looping in the air and bombing targets. if you can't bomb things you will get almost no kills. once you are good enough so that you can fly without crashing and can bomb targets go online. try to find a server that has a no attacking uncaps with vehicles rule, as this makes it easier to get into the air. once you're up and flying, make sure you spend most of your time above 200 feet (61.0 m) and constantly look behind you, this prevents being shot down.  if you find a target, drop downwards so that you are almost heading straight down, when the target lines up drop bombs and pull up, go to the runway, re arm and repeat. convoys and populated areas are good targets as you can get 5+ kills in one bombing run. If you are in a server where you can attack the enemy's uncap then this will bring in lots of kills although this is very unfair for the opposition and they will probably want to kick you. make sure that if you find an enemy jet, follow it and shoot it down. enemy jets are a big threat to you. stay alive at all costs. the worst thing about flying jets is trying to get into them. there is usually a mob of noobs that exist for the sole purpose of jumping in front of you forcing a tk, not to mention all the enemy vehicles/snipers that see a person waiting for a jet as an easy kill. once you are good at it, jet flying can become the funnest part of bf2.
